111.content:
A mountain lies between Pewter City and Cerulean City in the Kanto region; Mt. Moon. Mt. Moon is far too steep to climb so the only way is through the mountain itself. Inside is a maze of caverns and tunnels filled with pokemon--mostly Zubat and Geodude or any number of rock-type pokemon. The mountain is also home to wild clefairy that would evolve into clefable when exposed to a Moon Stone. The mountain is known for its Moon Stones hence the name Mt. Moon. The mountain has been hit by countless meteorites over the years--those meteorites becoming Moon Stones. It is also home to pokemon fossils.
It's very easy to get lost in the tunnels of Mt. Moon. For someone like Misty--who grew up in Cerulean City--Mt. Moon is easy to navigate through. She had been visiting Mt. Moon ever since she was little. She felt some strange connection to Mt. Moon as if the mountain had been her home long ago. But that was sheer none sense; Misty had always lived in Cerulean and yet she couldn't shake this feeling that Mt. Moon had been her home once upon a time.
Misty was going through the tunnels of Mt. Moon now to meet up with Ash and Brock in Pewter City. Ash had come home to the Kanto region from one of the far-off regions he went off to every year or so. This time he was coming back from some place called Unova...which was far from Kanto. Each time that Ash came back home he would visit his friends Brock and Misty. Misty had wanted Ash to stay in Kanto but Ash was always looking for a new region to explore. The last time she had talked to Ash he had been going on about some region called Kalos or something like that. Before Ash went to Kalos, he decided to go back to Kanto for the spring and summer--perhaps for the rest of the year. That suited Misty just fine. Misty had missed Ash and she was eager to meet up with him again.
"Geodude!" came a sudden cry from the ground. Misty had tripped on a rock that turned out to be a Geodude. Misty tried to save herself from falling over to the hard rock floor of the cave but in vain. Misty hit the ground hard. Geodude huffed off to parts unknown. Misty grumbled as she got herself up from the ground. When she did so she noticed something shiny on the floor just ahead of where she had fallen. Misty took a closer look. The object was clearly a gem that was slightly smaller than a Moon Stone...which she knew because there was a Moon Stone right beside the gem. The gem was green in color...did that mean it was an emerald? Misty picked up the gem.
"This is pretty..." said Misty examining the gem more closely.
Mistress...
The voice was faint and came from inside her head!
"Hello?" asked Misty aloud.
There was no reply.
"Did you just talk?" asked Misty nervously looking at the gem.
No reply.
"Must have been my imagination" muttered Misty, pocketing the gem in her jean shorts and continued on her way to meet up with her two friends.

1111.content:
After finding a strange green toned gem in Mt. Moon's many cavernous mazes. Misty had thought she heard a voice come from it. But after question the stone and getting no response, she pocketed into her left jean short's pocket and continued on her way to Pewter City to meet up with Ash and Brock. However, while on her way there. A faint child-like voice whispered in her head, "Grrrrrooooooow." the word was softly said. Misty didn't hear this since her mind was on something else, but the voice continued to whisper softly in her mind.

As Misty was nearing Pewter City limits, she had tripped over yet another object, though this time it wasn't a Pokemon, but a exposed tree root. But before Misty could react to her fall, she suddenly heard the child-like voice whisper, "Grrrrrooooooow." Then Misty with out thinking, repeated out loud what she heard.

"Grrrrroooooooow?" Misty had asked in a confused tone.

Then the stone sitting comfortably in her left jean short's pocket started to glow faintly and started to pour energy into her left thigh. Misty didn't feel anything, since the pain from the fall was the only thing she was feeling, though she did start to feel this odd feeling starting to occur now. It was faint, but she could feel something. Like her skin was slowly stretching or something like that. It wasn't really painful, but it did feel very weird. Misty had finally stood up and dusted off her jean shorts and overall. But as she did this, she could help but feel like something was slightly off, but what though, she wondered.

After cleaning up herself, she continued on her way to Pewter City. Unknowing to her, she had grown almost a whole inch! But this was only the start of something really troubling...

Arriving in Pewter City...

Misty met up with Ash and Brock in Pewter city finally, though they quickly noticed the faint dirt stains all over her clothes. Ash snickered, while Brock asked what had happen. Misty shrugged at first and then remembered the cave. She explained about the Geodude she tripped over and was going to explain the tree root she tripped over too, but decided not to, since Ash was already snickering and she didn't want to give him an excuse in calling her a klutz... But the three went together into Pewter City and decided to do a few things together.

Brock asked if they wanted to try out the new mall that had just opened and both Ash and Misty agreed, though for different reasons. When they entered the mall, Misty thought of maybe buying a new set of clothes, since she did want something else to wear everyday besides her overall strap suspender, yellow t-shirt, jean short combo. It's not like she didn't like how she looked, it's just she like to have a little more option while she is still travailing with her friends and all. She had found some cute clothes and decided to try them all. Ash and Brock had comeback around in the mall and saw Misty buying some clothes. Brock sighed, "Oh no, she's buying clothes again... this will take a while Ash." Ash saw this and sighed, along with Pikachu. So the three decided to go eat at the food court maybe or something else till Misty's surfaces again.

As Misty was trying on some clothes, a clerk offered to help her. Misty accepted and thanked her. While Misty was in the middle of changing shirts, the stone started to flare up again. Misty started to exchange her clothes for the new ones with the clerk, when that odd whisper happen again. Only this time, Misty suddenly said the word out loud subconsciously, but then reacted unconsciously unaware as to what just happen. The store clerk stared at Misty with a puzzled look repeating what she had just said out loud too.

Misty quickly blushed and asked what did she just say to her? The store clerk then blushed and replied, "I-I just repeated what you just said, you said, grow. I didn't mean to miss."

Becoming red a crossed her face, she quickly jerked back into the changing room. The store clerk felt stupid and pleaded, "Please forgive me miss. I'm not trying to mock you. I really wasn't." Misty stepped back and tried to figure out what happen, she had said something with out truly realizing it. First she found a odd stone, and then sworn she heard a voice, and now she is speaking random words with out realizing it?! Was she going crazy she thought. But while this was all racing through her head, that odd skin stretching feeling was occurring once again. Though again, Misty hadn't realized it, she just felt it. Which only fueled her mini breakdown. Slowly her jean shorts began to slowly cup tighter around her upper thighs and waist line. It was slow and really unnoticeable, but it was happening. But not only to her shorts, but the rest of her clothes too. Her yellow t-shirt slowly rose up, but it was barely even half an inch higher though, with her suspenders growing just slightly tighter against her shoulders.

Misty had once again, grew another inch! But after calming down, she regained her composure and took in a deep breath, "It's okay, I'm okay, I'm just being a little too excited right now, that's it." After calming down, Misty pulled her head back through the curtain and faced the clothing store clerk face to face.

"Hey, I'm sorry, I don't know what happen. I guess I must be having one of those days." Misty laughed awkwardly.

The clothing store clerk felt better and smiled, since she now felt like she didn't insult her or something. Misty continued her attempt to try on some clothes, but for how long till her next whisper?

What will happen next?


=Addition Notice=
When ever she hears the whisper Grow from the young child-like voice in the gem, she subconsciously says it out loud as well. Like in a trance almost. She doesn't know she is growing yet and she isn't going to like it either. So for now, keep her spurts very small. The growth is also not very painful, but not pleasant either for the most part. Last, clothes do not grow with her, period.

11113.content:
Mercifully, whatever strangeness was going on with Misty stopped. No more child-like voices in her head, at least. The rest of her time clothes shopping went by in peace, trying out this and seeing how it matched up with that.

Well, mostly in peace. A vague but pervading sense of "offness" bothered her. Everything she tried felt smaller than it should have. But how could that be? She'd been wearing the same size for years! What was going on here? Incorrect measurements? No, not likely. Maybe it had to do with that weird, stretched-out feeling...

"Did I have a growth spurt?" she asked her reflection as she evaluated a navy blue tank top. "I don't look any fatter, and I haven't put on any muscle, so maybe I just...grew. I know I finished puberty a long time ago, but..."

She looked down to her shorts on the bench, specifically at a bump in one of its pockets. Was the gem causing all this? Was it sentient? She did start hearing that voice after picking it up, after all.

Sighing, Misty forced herself to focus on shopping. Fretting over things in a changing room wouldn't accomplish anything. Better to focus on her shopping trip now and...search Mt. Moon for clues later or something. And as she thought that last part, she couldn't help but smile a little.

------

"Wow, Misty. You sure are hungry today."

"Pika Pika."

Misty looked up from her lunch--a large combo meal of some fast food chain's signature burger--to find Ash, Pikachu, and Brock staring at her with mildly dumbfounded expressions.

"Yeah," she replied, her words muffled from her current mouthful, "I guess so."

"I don't think you ever dug into my cooking like this." There was a hint of dejection in Brock's voice.

"Oh!" Misty swallowed. "It's not that like this stuff that much! Really, it's got nothing on you, Brock! I'm just really, really hungry all of a sudden."

"Ah, okay then." Brock's mode seemed to lift a bit at that. "Did you have a light breakfast this morning?"

"No, I--"

"Because it's not healthy to under-eat."

Misty huffed. "I know that. My breakfast was the same amount it's always been. My trip through Mt. Moon must have taken more out of me than I thought."

Ash smirked. "You mean your trip over that Geodude?" He snickered, earning a disapproving look from Pikachu.

Glaring at him, Misty crammed the rest of the burger in her mouth, grumbling under her breath.

Brock sighed. "Ash, is this really how you plan on acting? It's been so long since we all got together..."

"Yeah, okay, you're right. Sorry, Misty." At least Ash dropped his smirk when he said that. "I guess Iris was right about me being a kid after all..."

Misty, currently grabbing a handful of fries, stopped and looked back up from her meal. "Who's Iris?"

Ash's face lit up. "She's a friend I made in Unova! See, just after I got there..."

------

Misty tried to listen to Ash's recounting of his adventures. Tried to. But between quelling her appetite and that "offness" she couldn't ignore, she could only offer his stories a fraction of her attention.

The rest of the group's trip through the mall wasn't much help either. Every other step she took only served to remind her of the weight in her pocket. She gripped the gem through her shorts every so often. Said shorts covered less of her thighs than usual. Or did they? It looked that way. Felt that way, too. But considering she could say something out of nowhere and not even realize it, her mental state didn't seem particularly trustworthy.

Which was very worrying, to say the least.

She ended up not buying anything else. "The clothes and lunch are all I can afford," she told them. Ash decided to buy a travel guide for Kalos, insisting he would study it thoroughly and not forget about it (Yeah right, Misty thought). Also some of Pikachu's favorite Poke-Food. Brock went with a new cookbook, hoping to treat all his siblings to something new. They spent the rest of the time either window shopping or just checking out what the mall had to offer. After a good few hours, they deemed the mall to be perfectly decent. Not quite on par with the Celadon Department Store (this new mall lacked an evolutionary stone shop, for example) but useful enough to be a worthwhile addition to Pewter City.

"Is it that late already?" Ash asked as they exited. The sun was setting, the sky awash with red, orange, and purple.

"Looks like it," Misty muttered in response. She looked in the direction of Mt. Moon. Her fingers once again wrapped around the gem-shaped bulge in her pocket. Home.

... Er, in the direction of home. She felt at home in Mt. Moon, yes, but that didn't make it her actual home, right? Right!

Anyway.

"I better get going."

"Are you sure?" Brock asked. "Cos I was thinking we could all have dinner at my place. My family would love to have you guys."

Ooh, Brock's cooking! She hadn't had that in forever! What a perfect to relive the old days. And they wouldn't even have to get lost in some woods like they used to!

And yet, Misty still found herself staring longingly at Mt. Moon. It almost called to her, begged her to come back.

"Sounds great! Count me in!"

"Pika-Pikachu!"

She turned to Ash and Pikachu. Their faces exuded eagerness. That Cilan person he'd talked about sounded like a great chef in his own right, but there was no way he could serve up the same dose of nostalgia that only Brock's culinary delights could.

And yet Mt. Moon...

112.content:
"What's that up ahead?"
The question came from Misty. Ash, Brock and Misty were walking down a well-worn path in a dense forest. This time the trio wasn't lost, oh no. The trio had a habit of getting lost on their journey but not this time. This time the three friends were heading to what was called the "Legendary Mansion" that was deep in the heart of the Jotho region. A recent discovery, the mansion was said to be the home of a legendary pokemon. The mansion had been long abandoned. The mansion was estimated to be more than a hundred years old and nobody knew who had owned it originally. What legendary pokemon had made the mansion its home? That's what Ash wanted to find out. There were stories that an incredibly old Ninetales lived in the mansion but a Ninetales wasn't considered a "legendary pokemon" even though Ninetales can live up to 1,000 years and said to have mystical powers that came from each of its nine tails.
"I think that's it" said Brock.
The path that the three were on had led them in a wide-open area and a rambling mansion loomed ahead. The mansion had five stories to it and was quite a large building. It also looked old; there was ivy covering most of it and a section of wall had fallen apart.
"It could take hours to look through that mansion" said Misty.
"Oh it doesn't look that big" said Ash.
"Are you kidding?" asked Misty. "that mansion looks like it can take up an entire city block!"
"Why not build the mansion in a city?" asked Brock.
"Who knows?" asked Ash. "maybe the owner was a rich recluse"

As the three approached the mansion they saw they weren't alone. Perhaps a dozen people were milling about the entrance. Right in front of the mansion was a grand garden and behind the mansion there was what looked like a giant hedge maze.
"What are all these people doing here?" asked Ash.
"They all came here to look for the legendary pokemon that's said to live here" said one of the people, a rather short and pudgy kid that looked to be 12 at the most. "but they're all to scared to go in"
"What's to be scared about?" asked Ash.
"Dude, Ninetales could put a curse on you" said the pudgy kid. "there's a Ninetales that lives here too"
"Ninetales isn't a legendary pokemon though" said Misty.
"I didn't say it was" said the pudgy kid.
"Well I'm not scared" said Ash. "I want to go in and catch any pokemon that are in there"
"Good luck with that" said the pudgy kid. "you can't catch a legendary pokemon"
"We'll see about that" said Ash boldly stepping forward and entering the mansion itself followed by Misty and Brock. Misty glanced back and the pudgy kid had suddenly disappeared.
"Well if that kid isn't scared, I'm not" said the only adult there, a woman in her mid-20s.


"What's your name?" asked Ash to the woman that had walked in with them.
"Carol" said the woman. She had long blond hair and average looks and features.

Misty jerked out of her sleep in a state of panic. She quickly glanced around and saw that the area around her was deserted. At first she didn't recognize the room she was in. It was filled with tables and beakers...it was some sort of lab by the looks of it. Looked to be abandoned for a long time as spider webs were everywhere and at least a quarter of the roof was missing. It had been a drop of rain that landed on her face that woke her up. She looked up and saw the clouds in the sky. Ivy was everywhere and a young tree was starting to grow right in the middle of the lab below a hole in the ceiling. Misty was all alone here.
What happened? Where was she? Where was this place? What was this place?! Why was she alone? Where was Ash and Brock? The last memory she had was being at a pokemon center. Pokemon center of which city though? Or was it a pokemon center in the middle of nowhere? The pokemon center didn't have a Nurse Joy running it....it was a man with long red hair and sharp features. His names was......Derek? Donald? Some name that started with the letter "D" she was sure of it. The man had said that...
Why couldn't she remember?!
"Are you sure you dropped it in there?" came a booming voice from outside. The voice came from a male. "isn't that where we chased those three intruders down?"
"No I'm not sure" came a second voice, a female voice. "All I know is that I don't have that potion anymore....and yes, that's where we chased those three little ones down....only caught two of 'em. The third must've ran off"
'What's wrong with their voices?' wondered Misty. The voices were booming as if...
Just then a giant hand came from the opening in the ceiling and started to grab the ground as if searching for something. Misty gave a tiny little yelp and moved out of the way as the giant hand came closer to her.

"Let's just knock the building down" said the male voice. "nobody is using it and nobody can fit in there anymore"
"There's the professor" replied the female voice. "he's still tiny for some reason. This is where he made that potion. He needs this place to make more"

Potion? Professor? What was going on here?! The giant hand went all around the room for a good five minutes.

"It isn't here" said the female and the giant hand vanished through the hole in the ceiling.

"What were you doing with another potion anyway?" asked the male. "are you planning to grow even taller?"

"Of course" said the female. "all the others keep calling me Shorty and I hate it. With another potion I won't be so short anymore"

"You aren't short" scoffed the male.

The two giant voices faded off in the distance and Misty was left wondering what on earth was happening here?

Misty had been under a table near the door to the lab. She scrambled from under the table and exited the lab and into a long hallway. She looked to her left and right. After a moment she headed for the right. The building looked to have been abandoned. The power was off so the only light was daylight and since it was rainy there wasn't much of it.

Misty came to an open door. She peeked inside the room and found a smaller lab. Unlike the lab she had left, this lab was filled with beakers of liquid. She entered the small lab to get a better look.

The liquid that was in the beakers was a yellowish green. Was this the potion that those voices were talking about? Those......giants?

There were three beakers that caught Misty's interest. Each of the three beakers had labels on them.


"Queen's Drink"
"Small Fry"
"Goddess of the forest"

"Wha...?" asked Misty.

The Labels also had instructions.

"Queen's Drink -- drink this to become the biggest in the village"
"Small Fry -- Drink this to become a "little" giant"
"Goddess of the forest -- A new potion that I've whipped up just yesterday. I'm still perfecting it. I'm not quite sure how tall a person would get if someone were to drink this potion. Ignore the name....I just like to give these potions of mine whimsical names"

"Why would anyone leave these potions here?" asked Misty. "so...these potions will make me grow? Why would I want to grow?"

Misty thought it over. She seemed to be in an area populated with giants and it seemed that these potions were the source of these giants...and that someone was supposedly making more. She hadn't found Ash or Brock yet and those two sounded like they were captured by these giants...but Misty seemed to have escaped somehow.

"If I'm to save Ash and Brock from these giants, it sounds like I need to become a giant myself" said Misty. "Alright then"

Which potion does Misty drink?

114.content:
Misty had a secret. Misty had a big secret that she told nobody about partially because she was afraid it might drive her friends away...and that she couldn't explain why she grew when she was angry. Proper angry. Not merely annoyed or miffed but seething anger. The more angrier she got the more she grew. She would eventually shrink back down to normal size when she calmed down but that took time; hours or even days at a time. There was no way to know how long it took her to shrink back down to normal. She suspected it had to do with how tall she grew. When she grew her clothes would be torn apart and left in tatters and she would be naked. Luckily Misty learned to carry an extra set of clothes in her bag.
Misty didn't knew where this ability came from either; her three sisters didn't have it...a fact that made her smile every time she thought about it. Misty discovered this ability when she turned ten. She didn't know if she had been born with this odd ability or not but she recalled no instance where she grew in her younger days.

She had discovered this ability of hers shortly before she met Ash. When he had "borrowed" her bike. After discovering the remains of her bike Misty grew until she was near thirty feet tall; luckily she had shrank back down--to a mere seven feet--by the time that she ran into Ash in Viridian City. That was the quickest time that she had shrank back down. She had been seething mad when she discovered her ruined bike on the dirt road but she had calmed down a bit. She was still mad at Ash but not mad enough to make her grow back to who knows how tall.


Right now Misty was lying down in her sleeping bag. Ash, Brock and Misty were camping out once again. Misty was looking up at the stars thinking about the passing years. For it had been several years now and Ash was continuing his grand pokemon adventure and Misty and Brock decided to stay with him. The snores of Ash and Brock was beginning to make her angry. Can't those two keep quiet?!

(a/v Note: I leave it to you if Misty told Ash or Brock about her ability)

1141.content:
Misty tried her best to keep her cool, thinking "calm" thoughts in an effort to keep herself from growing. Unfortunately, her attempts at visualizing gentle waves at a beach and calmly swimming Water Pokémon did little to temper her growing rage. The waves in her mind became tsunamis, and the school of swimming Magikarps became raging Gyarados. 'Ugh... how much is it to ask to let me have my beauty sleep?!' she thought to herself. By this point, it seemed it was too late to stop it-- she could already feel her shorts and top getting tight as her legs grew longer and thicker and her chest inflated. Within a few moments, her suspenders had snapped, and Misty could feel an unstoppable power welling up within, a simultaneously fearful and arousing feeling.

"N-No...not now..." she muttered, trying desperately to hold it in. She couldn't fight her anger, though, and all rational thoughts were blocked out by her inner voice screaming about Ash and Brock's perceived inconsiderateness. How dare they make so much noise, as if no one and nothing else in the world mattered but them?! That was enough to push her over the edge, and Misty's growth went into overdrive-- she began to rapidly rise up in height, her shorts and tiny tank top bursting off of her growing body, with her ballooning breasts and ass demolishing her underwear immediately after. 10 feet soon became 20, then 30, 40, 50, and beyond... she kept right on growing as she took a powerful step toward her sleeping companions, shaking them awake with the shockwaves. They awoke to a terrifying surprise-- Misty has so far managed to somehow keep her ability a secret from them over the years, either through careful management of her anger or conveniently disappearing when things got out of hand. There was simply no hiding it now, though, and she roared like a giant monster as the boys sprung from their sleeping bags and ran into the woods.

Team Rocket makes an ill-timed appearence
11412.content:
When Misty usually grew like this her thoughts were all red and muddled. Her first instinct to seeing Ash and Brock flee before her was to chase them down and punish them for making such a racket. She gave chase mere moments after the two had vanished into the woods. She stomped trees flat, scared bunches of sleeping pokemon and flattened smaller trees in her rage-filled chase. She didn't grew any more and her sight had a red covering over it. She saw no signs of the tiny Ash and Brock but she could hear them somewhere up ahead. It was clear the two boys were too frightened to talk to each other let alone discuss what the hell happened to their friend.
Misty kept on chasing them until she could no longer hear the two boys in front of her. When she could no longer hear Ash and Brock running from her, her red-tinted sight started to lower. That was when Misty's head started to clear. Before her mind was filled with mindless rage and pure predator's instinct to chase her quarry and possibly feed on them for daring to anger her. But now, her mind started to clear and she no longer wished to eat Ash or Brock--in fact the thought sickened her! Why would she ever do that? Why would she even think of it?! Of course it was all a part of growing. Whenever she grew, Misty's mind became that of a raging animal. Now Misty realized what she had done; she had chased Ash and Brock, most likely scaring the two nearly to death.
"Ash!" called Misty. "Brock! I'm not mad anymore!"
She started to search for her two friends. Now that she was calm, Misty expected that she would shrink back down.....only she didn't. She still stayed the same size at...how tall was she now? Judging by the trees she towered over, Misty estimated her height to be a little over eighty feet. Why wasn't she shrinking? Misty wasn't panicked. After all she was used to not shrinking right away. But it still bothered her that she was now looking for her friends as a giant. Would they even approach her now?
"Ash!" called Misty. "Brock! I'm sorry I scared you. I'm better now!"
No answer.
"Why am I not shrinking?!" asked Misty aloud. Then she calmed down, not wanting to trigger another growth spurt.

1151.content:
(this chapter was originally written by Drez)

Misty awoke with a bad headache and a bad memory. The last memory that Misty had was the three of them--Ash, herself and Brock--heading for the lifeboats because the ocean liner they were on was sinking for some reason. What exactly caused the ship to sink she couldn't remember. She had a vague memory of running into Team Rocket at one point....were they in the lifeboat too? Had those three caused the ship to sink?
It was the sound of hammering that had awoken Misty. The next thing that Misty noticed was the breeze that came across her body. She opened her eyes which felt slightly gummy and saw a blue sky with a few clouds. From what she could tell she was lying on a beach. She tried to sit up but was restrained. Puzzled, Misty lowered her head so she could see the rest of her body where she noticed two things; she was completely naked and she was covered up in tiny little ropes! She tried to break free from the ropes but it was no use. There must've been thousands of ropes tied around her body....and they were such tiny little things! How could something that small be so strong?! And why was she naked?! Did some pervert remove her clothes? For several minutes, Misty struggled in the tiny little ropes that held her down. She managed to break few of the ropes but she was still held down.
"She's awake!" yelled a tiny voice. Misty looked around and saw a tiny little person standing on her exposed chest somewhat close to her nipple. The little person was dressed in blue jeans and a plain shirt. Misty squinted at the person who looked familiar.
"Of course I'm awake" said Misty. The sheer volume of her voice made the little person cover his ears. Misty winced and lowered her voice to ask a question. "where am I anyway?"
"You're on the island of Lillia" replied the little person. "my name is Roger. I'm the one that found you"
"What happened to my clothes?" asked Misty in her lowered voice. "why can't I break free of these ropes? Why are you so small?"
"So many questions..." said Roger. "I simply found you that way; I saw no clothing that could fit someone as big as you. The ropes are made from this strong material found on this island and.....I'm this size because I was born this way"
"That's enough, Roger" snapped another voice and another tiny person appeared on Misty's chest! The tiny person must've climbed up on her body clearly but why couldn't she felt these little people walking on her? The little people were perhaps twenty inches tall. The second tiny person was dressed in some kind of paramilitary uniform. "Don't tell the giantess our secrets"
"And who are you?" asked Misty to the second person.
"I'm Captain Hawk of the Lillia army" said the second person.
"Did you happen to see anyone else my size?" asked Misty.
"No" said Hawk.
"Should there be?" asked Roger.
"At least two" said Misty.
"Oh great" said Captain Hawk "just what we needed. An invasion of giants"
"We're not invading!" snapped Misty. "we were in a ship that sunk!"
Captain Hawk and Roger exchanged glances. "Must've been the reef" said Roger.
"This island is surrounded by a razor-sharp reef" said Captain Hawk. "if ships aren't careful they can run into it and sink"
"That's how we came to be here" said Roger.
"Don't tell her about us!" barked Captain Hawk.
"Okay..." said Misty. "why did you tie me up?!"
"To prevent you from going berserk and killing all on this island" said Captain Hawk.
"But I wouldn't do that" said Misty.
"That's what they all say" said Captain Hawk. "my superiors are trying to figure out what to do with you now"
"I won't hurt anyone" said Misty. "I'm just trying to figure out what is going on here"

"Can't we free her?" asked Roger.
"Why are you still here?" asked Captain Hawk. "this is a military matter now. Get out of here"
"I was the one who found her!" protested Roger.
"And?" asked Hawk. "either get out of here or I'll make you leave"
"Hey be nice to him!" said Misty.
"Quiet, giant!"
"My name is Misty" said Misty.
At the mention of Misty's name, both Roger and Captain Hawk looked at each other with slightly shocked expressions. Captain Hawk looked at Misty then back at Roger and then back to Misty again. Roger just looked dumbfounded.
"What?" asked Misty.
"It means nothing" said Captain Hawk firmly to Roger. "she doesn't match the description in the legend. She has red hair, not blond"
"What legend?" asked Misty. "what are you talking about?" Roger tried to say something but Captain Hawk stopped him.
1151.title: Not exactly Gulliver

1152.content:
Alright, bear with me here-- in the spirit of this interactive, namely the resurrection of the old style of interactives that you don't see often anymore, I wanted to use this storyline to try and bring back a whole story that was taken down a long time ago. So here's what happened-- a good 10 or so years ago, there were two "Nintendo Girls Gain Weight" stories, the second of which began a storyline with Misty that outlived NGGW2 itself and continued in a separate interactive simply called "Misty's gain: the continuation". By the time I joined, only Misty's gain was still online, and it had a single cohesive storyline that revolved around a fat giantess Misty (see? it's relevant to the GTS theme after all!), starting at 30 feet and growing steadily through all the subsequent chapters. From what I remember, she was on a vacation in some island chain that was famous for ice cream and desserts, and spent most chapters either indulging on her own or getting caught in contrived Team Rocket schemes that always ended in her getting fed for some reason. It was a simplistic story, but fun as all hell, and I was sad to see it go.

That said, I'm in charge now with this story, so it's time for a reboot! We can start the same way the original story did, with 30-foot, super fat Misty stomping her way into a town in search of fattening sweets, with the backstory all in broad strokes so we have wiggle room to write the way we want while still preserving the fun, silly spirit of the original. Those who remember it are free to add in anything they recall from the original, but I encourage folks to just do what they want with the setup as well, and as usual I'll see if I can add a lot more continuity nods and links to the anime and game canons as well.

1153.content:
Come back....
come back....
come back....


Misty was swimming in the ocean. She had no memory of how she came to be swimming in the ocean but that didn't seem to bother her. What bothered her was that she could hear voices coming from the dark depths below her. She stopped swimming and listened more closely. She didn't hear anything else but she did felt something grab her foot and she was dragged underwater. She couldn't see who or what was dragging her deeper and deeper. Misty was able to breathe which came as a shock. That's when she noticed her body was beginning to change. She felt gill slits forming on her throat, and her legs had fused together to form a giant fin. She was also gaining in size. By the time she reached the ocean floor, Misty must've been at least 300 feet long.
Misty came to rest besides a huge golden trident that was clearly meant for her. The trident emitted a golden light that was almost blinding. There were runes or mystical symbols on the trident itself that Misty could barely see. The trident was sticking out of a huge boulder. The boulder was nearly as big as Misty was. Misty squinted at the boulder to see an inscription written on the boulder near where the trident was sticking out. The inscription read: I shall return to claim this trident of mine and become the goddess of the sea once more . Reading the inscription made something inside Misty twinge as if she was trying to recall a long-forgotten memory.....

Misty awoke to the smell of breakfast cooking. She awoke gradually and found that her arms were reaching for something that wasn't there. She blinked several times. She remembered the dream she just had vividly.

"Morning, Misty" came Ash's voice.

Ash, Misty and Brock were in a large clearing of the forest. Brock was cooking breakfast and had set up a small table with chairs for three. Ash was sitting at the table sipping at a cup filled with what looked like orange juice. Pikachu was on the table itself, looking just barely awake.

"Breakfast should be ready in five minutes" said Brock.

"Are you alright, Misty?" asked Ash.

"Yeah" said Misty getting up from her sleeping bag. "just had a weird dream"


----------------------------------

Two Choices lie ahead


Option 1: Ash, Misty and Brock are on vacation. They go to beach for some fun in the sun when Misty discovers a mysterious trident under the water of the ocean. When she touches the trident, Misty gets transformed into a gigantic mermaid and ends up being the goddess of the sea.

Option 2: The trio are on vacation and go to the beach. Misty gains memories of when she used to be a mermaid long ago. Not only a mermaid but an avatar of the sea goddess, meaning that Misty isn't the sea goddess but wields the power of the sea goddess as long as she holds a trident which lies under the water somewhere. Of course Misty would be a gigantic mermaid in both choices since this is a GTS story. Just how gigantic can be sorted out later.

11533.content:
Even though we've explored this idea before, it has never been the main focus of the story.

In the interactive story "TV Vore" , in a long storyline which Jake and i wrote Ash discovers that he's a demigod, child of the goddess of fertility.....which is of course Delia. I got the idea based on all those fan theories on why Ash never ages and I decided to create my own idea that was just as ridiculous as some of the other theories. Demigods age slower than normal people, therefore Ash appears not to age at all even though he is.

In the story, Ash is returning home for his eighteenth birthday. On the way home, Ash experiences mysterious dreams about his mother telling him that his life is going to change dramatically. Just before he gets home, his godly powers awaken turning him into a giant.

I know we've been having lots of stories involving people turning into gods or godlike figures, but the whole "giant" thing is supposed to be a metaphor of a person gaining incredible powers like a God......at least, in part. So if any of you have any problems with that, I do apologize but when a person turns into a giant in other media, they're usually invincible to pretty much everything......Like a God. Hell, GOD is in the name Godzilla. I can't see why a person that turns into a giant turns out to be an actual God......Or demigod in this case.

Yes, Jake, this is a total reboot of that whole story.....minus the other stuff that went on in that storyline

115331.content:
"I'm home!" Sang out Ash Ketchum as he entered his own house in Pallet Town. No longer a young kid, Ash was now eighteen. He was dressed in nothing but his boxer shorts and his trademark hat. He made his way to the kitchen. In the kitchen were two people: his mother and what looked like a copy of himself.

The copy of himself had weird eyes. Red pupils and pure black eyes gazed up at Ash from the simple kitchen table. The expression on the copy's face was unreadable. His mother was busy at the stove.

The copy was wearing Ash's clothing, though the colors were reversed. On the face of the copy was weird sigils and runes all over. As Ash watched, a sigil vanished.

"Welcome home, honey" said Delia.

"Welcome" echoed the copy in a slightly deeper voice.

"Who's this?" asked Ash, nodding at the copy.

"The better half" said the copy.

Delia turned and glared at the copy. "Arguably the better half"

The copy grimaced but said nothing.

"Ashley, I have something important to tell you" said Delia, turning to face Ash. Ash blushed at the name.

"Don't call me that!" Yelled Ash and the copy in unison. Ash and the copy exchanged a glance.

Delia giggled. "Come home, honey. And do hurry up, won't you? This is quite important"

"I am home" said Ash, confused.

"That is my better half?" asked the copy, jerking his head at Ash.

"Don't be rude" said Delia. To Ash, she said: "I've invited all your friends for your birthday"

"Two days from now" said the copy. "I'll break this pesky seal before then. It's very weak now and getting weaker by the moment"

"I know" said Delia. "That's the reason you're here now"

"Mom?" Asked Ash. "What's going on here?"

"I'll explain everything to you once you get here" said Delia.

"Explain" sneered the copy. "Yeah that'll be a fun conversation"

Ash woke with a start. He found himself in his sleeping bag next to Misty. Memories of last night brought a smile to Ash's handsome face. Dawn was just beginning to break. Just two days before his eighteenth birthday.

He and Misty were just outside Viridian City. The pair had gotten too sleepy to actually make it to the city so they set up camp on the edge of the forest.

Ash and Misty walked into Viridian City. Pikachu sat on Ash's shoulder. The pair really didn't have a plan besides going straight to Pallet in time for Ash's eighteenth birthday....but that was two days away so they had some time to kill. The two decided to head for the pokemon center to heal up their pokemon since the pair had been in several battles just yesterday.
It was a block away from the center when a poster caught Ash's attention. It was for the opening of a brand new arcade called "Hard Eight Arcade" the opening of which was in three days.
"A new arcade that features the latest in VR technology...".said Misty reading off the poster. "Sounds like fun"
"Yeah" said Ash.
As they neared the pokemon center they saw a sandy-browned trainer around twenty at the most standing beside an usual pokemon to be seen in the Kanto region: a Delphox. As Ash and Misty approached the other pair, they noticed that the pair was clearly talking to each other. Delphox, being psychic, could talk through telepathy
"Are you worried about that vision you had this morning, Circe?" asked the trainer.
Circe nodded and glanced over at Ash. The pokemon pointed at Ash.
"It involves him?"asked the trainer. The Fox pokemon nodded.
"Umm....your pokemon had a vision about me?" asked Ash coming up on the trainer.
"Apparently" said the trainer. "Circe can glimpse into the future by looking at the flame at the end of its stick"
"What was it about?" asked Misty.
"(Something about two days from now)" came a feminine voice in Ash and Misty's head. "(And about you learning a deep secret......and a binge....I couldn't see anymore than that)"
Ash and Misty exchanged glances.
"Circe's predictions are usually pretty good" said the trainer. "By the way, my name is Felix"
"Nice to meet you" said Ash.
"According to Circe here" said Felix "I'm also involved"
Circe faced Felix and clearly talked to him privately via telepathy. Felix eyed Circe with an odd expression that was unreadable to Ash and Misty. "She's not coming back. She hasn't been seen in twenty years"
"Who hasn't been seen in twenty years?" asked Misty.
"Nobody important" said Felix.
"Well" said Ash. "Is that your way of inviting yourself to join us? I don't mind the company"
"The more the merrier" said Misty.


Delia Ketchum sat in an arcane circle in Ash's room. She was chanting under her breath and the arcane circle glowed with a soft blue color. Delia's forehead was adorned with sigils and mystical symbols.
"You're wasting time" came the voice of her son. "The seal you've set up is breaking. You can't reinforce it. I've grown strong"
Delia kept on chanting.
"I'll break the seal before he comes home"
More chanting was the only reply
"I'll break the seal and devour him all up. And then the fun begins"
"Limited fun" said Delia, opening her eyes and saw the embodiment of Ash's locked-up powers which wasn't visible to the mortal eye.
"Fun nevertheless" said the Ash copy. "I wonder what his reaction will be when he finds out the truth"
"It won't matter" said Delia. "When you devour him, Ash will know why I sealed you away up until now"
"I'm talking about the other truth" said the Ash copy grinning like a naughty puppy allowed back in the house.
Delia grimaced. "......he'll still love me. I'm his mother"
"We'll see" said Copy Ash, shrugging.

As it turned out, Felix's uncle was opening the arcade that was going to open. Felix had invited Ash and Misty to the arcade for a sneak peek. Circe followed and explained that she was one of those Pokemon who disliked being inside a pokeball.
"Actually, he's my great uncle" said Felix. " Great Uncle Ernie is the only family I have left. I never knew my parents and my grandparents died before I was even born"

A tied-up man was lying on the bed. The man was in his mid to late 50s. As Delia entered the room the man turned a fearful gaze in her direction but Delia simply ignored him. She went over to the closet and opened it up.

Delia was just about to start the fun when the doorbell unexpectedly rang. Delia shot a glance at the still open door to the bedroom before strolling out of the room closing the door behind her.
Delia managed to control her facial expression by the time she had opened the door.
Gary Oak was standing there at the door blushing red. He was wearing a dress suit complete with a carnation. His hair hand been let down and he looked noticeably uncomfortable on the stoop. Delia blinked at him blankly and that's when she suddenly remembered. There was a fund raiser gala at the museum in Viridian City that featured a new exhibit that featured her as the goddess of fertility. A week earlier she had invited Gary because he had been snooping around the house lately .
"You ready?" asked Gary holding out his arm to Delia.
"Uhh...yeah" said Delia stepping out of the house and locking the door.

By the time that the copy of Ash reached Viridian City it was well past midnight . He paused as he entered the city limits as he closed his eyes and focused. Copy Ash smiled when he sensed the other half of his being.
The Copy made his way to the Pokemon center. The doors were shut but the copy just went through the door like a ghost.
The Copy entered the room where his other half was sleeping. The Copy glanced in the direction of the bathroom to the room revealing the fact that Misty was in there. The Copy made a lewd expression and then hurried on to the task at hand.
Copy Ash grabbed his other half roughly off the bed. Ash opened his eyes, startled at what he saw.
"You?!" asked Ash. " You're from that dream"
"That was no dream" said the copy opening his mouth wide and engulfed Ash's head into his mouth. Ash struggled as his copy swallowed him up slowly. As the copy ate him, Ash had this feeling of calm washed over him.....and then he felt a surge of power enter his body.
"What....?" asked Ash dreamily as the power entering his body made him light headed. The Copy grinned as another swallow brought Ash's chest into the mouth. The Copy wasted little time in swallowing his other half, growing impatient. When the copy slurped up Ash's legs he wanted it to happen.....he didn't knew what was going to happen but it was going to be glorious.
The Copy swallowed one more time, sending Ash down to his stomach....except Ash didn't end up in the stomach. When the copy swallowed Ash a golden light emitted from the body and radiated with blinding light for a full minute, totally obscuring what was happening from view. When the light faded away Ash simply laid on the bed breathing heavily.
Ash's body had undergone a metamorphosis. His new body was ripling with muscle, his biceps gaining in size until they were twice the size they were. His muscles had a sculpted look. The shirt he had been wearing had been torn to pieces with budging muscle.
"Mom....is a goddess?" asked Ash quietly to himself . Yes. She had sealed away his power to protect himself and others....but that only lasted for eighteen years. The seal had broken.....that was what made the sound he had heard earlier! But that happened all the way in Pallet..so how.....
"Ash?"
Ash turned to face Misty dressed only in a silky kimono. The sight of Misty might as well been the dinner bell ringing. The thought that Misty now looked like food didn't matter to Ash. Ash rushed over to Misty and gave her a long lingering kiss that brought the young adultl to her knees. She broke off the kiss and stared at Ash in bewilderment.
"Ash?" asked Misty " what happened to you? ". Misty traced her fingers on Ash's chest.
"Enough talk" said Ash kissing her again. "Call me god"
"Call....you...?" asked Misty as her expression turned lustful . Ash kissed her again.
"It feels good to call me God" whispered Ash. When Ash had said the word God Misty experienced an orgasm without Ash touching her.
" Ash?! " asked Misty. "How did you....?"
" Call me God, Misty "

115331111.content:
The Natural History Museum in Viridian City was a sprawling complex. It had only three floors but the building was nearly the size of two city blocks. The fundraiser gala event was a special event that started at ten o'clock and ended until one in the morning. The museum normally was only opened from dawn until dusk.
The gala event was invitation only. It was only opened to millionaires and other such people that were community leaders or prominent people throughout the Kanto Region.
Delia wasn't mailed an invitation to the gala which must've been an oversight. The gala was to celebrate a brand-new exhibit dedicated to the ancient goddess of fertility...and to raise money for the museum itself since the museum was in danger of closing due to poor attentece. The museum hadn't had a new exhibit for twenty years so it was kinda a big deal.
When Gary and Delia arrived at the museum they were in danger of being turned away because they had no invitation to the event.
"We're special guests of the curator" said Delia. "You can call him and tell him that Delia Ketchum is here"
The guard raised an eyebrow at this but picked up a phone at the reception desk.
"You know the curator?" whispered Gary.
Delia nodded. "Donald is an old friend of mine. Believe me he'll let us in"
The guard at the reception desk talked on the phone for a long time before nodding and hung up the phone.
"The Delia Exhibition is located in the "Ancient Civilizations" section on the first floor" said the guard. "Just follow the signs. You can't miss it. Oh, and the curator will meet you there personally"
"Thank you" said Delia. " Come on, Gary"
Gary and Delia walked down a series of corridors. Signs led the pair to the event. Every other exhibit in the museum was closed. The gala was only for a specific exhibit after all. As such the museum was pretty much deserted save for the people at the gala.
"So there's an ancient goddess out there that shares your name?" asked Gary as the two continued their way.
"Apparently so" said Delia who had a thin smile on her face.
Just before Delia and Gary could enter the "Ancient Civilizations" section of the museum they were met by an elderly man probably in his 60s or even 70s. The man wore a dark blue suit over a dress shirt. A bowtie was just visible under the man's chin. The man was heavyset, probably weighing three hundred pounds soaking wet.
"Ah, Delia, my special guest" said the man when Gary and Delia came within hailing distance. "I'm the curator of this museum. Who is this young man with you?"
" He's my plus one" said Delia gesturing at Gary.
It was then that Gary noticed that Delia was now wearing an elegant light blue dress she certainly wasn't wearing earlier. When the two entered the museum Delia had been wearing her standard clothing but now she now was wearing a dress. Gary blinked as he looked at Delia in her sudden new outfit in awe.
"I see" said Donald the curator. "The gala starts in ten minutes. Please enjoy the show"
" Mind if I had a little chat with you in your office? " asked Delia. "Gary, you can go mingle with the guests at the gala"
"Sure" said Donald.
Gary looked uncertain.
"Go on" said Delia to Gary.
Gary shrugged and walked off in one direction while Delia and Donald went in another.

When Delia and Donald entered the office of the curator, Donald made it a point to lock the door before prostrating before Delia.
"You honor me with this visit, goddess" said Donald .
Delia hesitated before speaking. "What happened to my invitation to this event? You open a exhibit to me and you couldn't be bothered with sending me an invitation?"
"A terrible oversight on my part" said Donald. "I didn't know where you lived in Kanto"
"I did pick a remote place to live in" said Delia, more to herself.
"Is this a sign of your return?" asked Donald. "You were gone so long that your worshippers are beginning to thin out"
"Don't I know it" said Delia. "Yes, I'm here to inform you that I am returning to all my worshippers within the month"
" I'm overjoyed by this news, goddess " said Donald. "Most of your cult in Viridian are here at the gala. Are you going to reveal yourself at the gala?"
" I shall reveal myself at my temples throughout the world " said Delia. "A temple is much more an appropriate venue to reveal myself as a goddess than at some gala"
" I couldn't agree more" said Donald.


Gary mingled among the sixty or so people that were at the gala. It wasn't long before Gary saw an ancient mural that depicted the goddess called Delia. It was unmistakably Delia Ketchum depicted in the mural.
"Surely not...." muttered Gary rubbing his chin.
"Surely not what?" asked a voice in his ear. Gary looked to see Delia was standing beside him.
" Err...surely that isn't you " said Gary nodding at the mural.
Delia looked at the mural. "Hmm...not a bad likeness"
Gary blinked. "You don't mean you're a god?!"
" And what if I am? " asked Delia.
Before Gary could even think of what to say next the ground shook several times.
"An earthquake?!" asked one of the guests .
Delia looked sharply in a northerly direction. Gary looked in the direction that Delia was looking at but only saw a blank wall.
"What is it?" asked Gary .
"Ash...." said Delia in a whisper .

************

Ash rushed out of the Pokemon center followed quickly by Misty. Ash was a little over seven feet tall and was still growing in height. Minutes earlier Ash's body had undergone a transformation of some kind....a transformation that clearly wasn't over. After Ash's body had changed he told Misty that moving out of the Pokemon center would be a good idea. After making this announcement Ash had started to grow at a rapid pace.
Now that the pair was out of the Pokemon center, Ash's growth was even more rapid. Seven feet soon became ten feet, then 20, 30, 40, 50, 60 feet and still growing! Ash's clothes were ripped apart by the growth leaving him quite naked. Ash was sure to avoid damaging any building while he was growing.
Ash grew and grew, passing 100 feet. By this time Ash had made it out of the city. He had picked up Misty when he surpassed 50 feet.
Ash stopped growing at 500 feet tall.
"Why did you suddenly grow?" asked Misty who was on Ash's hand, holding onto his pinky finger .
"That's what I want to konw" said Ash.
"And what is this business about you being a god?" asked Misty.
" I believe I can answer that question " said a voice. Ash looked around until he spotted his mother nearby. Delia had matched Ash's size....and she was also naked.
"Mom?" asked Ash. " Exactly what is going on? "
Delia sighed deeply. "This isn't the way I wanted to reveal this to you. I was hoping that your powers would return on your birthday and not two days before. Very well.
You're not a god,, but a demigod. Your father was mortal. The woman he fell in love with is an ancient goddess of fertility...me. Yes. I am a goddess. When you were born I sealed away your godly powers to protect the people around you. The seal holding back your powers broke earlier tonight. You grew because you're not used to the power that you now have"
Ash just stared blankly at his mother.
"I was going to tell you this at your birthday party but your powers came earlier than expected" said Delia.
" So.... " said Ash slowly. "I'm a demigod now....is there anything else that you would like to reveal to me? "

1153311111.content:
Ash and Delia stood in the very outskirts of Viridian Forest. The trees there hardly came up to their knees which meant the two giants were quite visible. Viridian City looked like a city of dollhouses to Ash. He was sorely tempted to go into the city and start stomping the city flat. He was able to ignore the temptation.
"Look" said Delia. "I know all this comes to a shock all of a sudden"
" Oh no mother dear" said Ash, sarcasm dripping from his voice. "What's so shocking for me to learn that I'm a demigod and you're a goddess and that you've been keeping this secret from me my whole life?"
" Ash, I know" said Delia. "You're upset and --"
"You said my father was a mortal?" asked Ash, interrupting his mother. "Where is he then? Did he run out on you? Was he not worthy of your love?"
" Ash--" started Delia.
"Did you even love him or did you dump him for being a mere mortal?!" asked Ash. "No....I bet you didn't even love him and---"
The very next thing that Ash knew he was down on his hands and knees with blood pouring out of his ears, nose and mouth. His heart was doing its best impression of a dial tone and he was absolutely terrified. He had absolutely no memory of what caused him to be in this state.....and, perhaps, that was a good thing. Misty was in the same state it seemed as she was pleading for forgiveness from Delia even though Misty did nothing wrong.
"What...?" asked Ash his voice coming out as a little squeak.
"I'm sorry I lost my temper" said Delia.
Ash climbed unsteadily to his feet.
"Your father......" said Delia. " Your father is dead, Ash. He was killed before you were born.....and I did love him. He was a good man"
"If he was killed couldn't you have resurrected him?" asked Ash. " I mean you're a goddess aren't you? "
Delia sighed deeply. "No, Ash. I can't resurrect the dead. What's dead is dead. True resurrection is reserved only for the most powerful gods and, even then, resurrection is a dicey thing"
Silence hung in the air for long minutes.
"How did he die?" Ash finally asked.
"To answer that, let me tell you how we met" said Delia.


~~~~~~~~~~~~Flashback~~~~~~~


It was twenty-five years ago when I met two mortals. One of them was your father, Ash, while the other was the son of a wealthy family.
I met the two in Pewter City. I make a habit of hanging out with mortals.
The three of us grew close over the course of two years. During that time, the mother of the other mortal grew helplessly sick.
I believe it was cancer if I recall correctly. Anyway, your father and this other gentleman were friends since childhood. In time I started to date the other gentleman but he wasn't interested in having offspring.
As the mother got sicker and sicker, this gentleman started to neglect me and steadily became more aggressive. It got to the point where i couldn't stand to be with him.....and so I started to have an affair with the man that became your father, Ash. At first it was a way to cure my loneliness but our relationship got more and more serious. Eventually we told my ex about our affair and he seemed to be alright with it.
Then the mother of this gentleman died, leaving behind a legacy for her son. That legacy being a crime syndicate by the name of Team Rocket. It horrified me that I dated someone belonging to a criminal family.
Your father and I moved to Pallet shortly after Giovanni took over Team Rocket. Your father soon severed all ties with his childhood friend. We were ready to start a family. I revealed my true nature to your father and he was alright with it.
And then.....one night when I was off doing a ceremony in one of my temples I felt that something awful happened to your father back in Pallet. I had to leave the ceremony but i was already too late. Your father was in the street, shot dead by thugs from Team Rocket. Four of my priests tried to apprehend the man who had killed your father but were killed in the attempt. I had to apprehend the man that killed your father myself.
Your father died in my arms, Ash. I told him that I couldn't save him nor could I resurrect him. He said he had no regrets falling in love with a goddess. His last thoughts were about you, my son.

Delia.....take good care of our child.......



~~~~~~~~~~~~~end of flashback~~~~~~~

Ash stood there as Delia finished her story.
"What a story...." muttered Misty.
It was then that Ash noticed a clawing sensation up his leg. He looked down to see that pikachu had finally caught up with him. Pikachu climbed up to his hand where Misty was standing and climbed up to her shoulder.
"Your father would be proud" said Delia.
" I bet he would... " said Ash in a hollow voice. Ash then looked around. "Umm...when will I shrink back down?"
" My guess? " asked Delia. "Probably in the morning. Your body needs to adapt to the power coursing through it"
" Morning?! " asked Misty. "But it's not even midnight yet"
Delia shrugged . "Look at it this way; you have all night to have fun being five hundred feet tall. Now, if you don't mind, I have an engagement to get back too"
Without further ado, Delia just vanished from sight. There was no poof of smoke or anything like that. She was just gone.
"Fun?" asked Misty faintly.
Ash looked over at the city of doll houses that was Viridian City and smiled.
"Ash" said Misty. "Don't go smashing up the city!"
" Alright " said Ash. "I wasn't going to anyway. I'm a bit peckish"
Here, Ash uprooted a nearby apple tree and tossed it into his mouth. He picked up another tree, this one filled with berries. He tossed the entire tree into his mouth. Ash didn't even chewed: he swallowed it down whole .
"I feel like having a feast" said Ash stomping his way back into the city itself . Ash soon came upon a burger restaurant and simply ripped the building off of its foundation and opened the tiny doors and tipped the restaurant to his open mouth. Uncooked food came pouring from the open doors and into his mouth. There was even a poor janitor that got swallowed down. Ash set the restaurant back on the ground and moved on.

Silver and Gary turned to face Delia. Silver had a natural expression as he nodded in greeting. " Hello mother "

Ash gets an invitation to a brand-new Pokemon theme park that's opening in the Unova region. The park is like any other amusement park: it has rides, shows, stunt shows, and everything else that an amusement park has. Ash finds out that the park is actually ran by three extremely powerful pokemon that call themselves The Three Vixens. The Three Vixens are: Delphox, Zoroark and Ninetales. As the name implies all three are females.

I got the idea From the park in the anime movie "Pom Poko" which features an amusement park ran by kitsunes. While Pom Poko is not my favorite Studio Ghibli movie, a park ran by shape-shifting foxes is a fantastic idea. And those three Fox pokemon fit in with the kitsune myths.

My only problem is I'm not sure who the viewpoint character should be. I'm thinking of Ash.....but it can really be anyone.

Since Zoroark can create illusions, the Three Vixens appear as three attractive human women when out in public. Only a handfull of trainers at the park discovers the truth. One or all three can have romantic feelings towards a human.

The GTS/GT can come from Zoroark's illusions or Delphox's psychic ability to make someone grow and Ninetales can turn humans into any type of Pokemon with her hex ability so there's an opportunity for TF.

The Three Vixens aren't against being caught by a trainer but each of the three are unusually powerful so the chances of that happening is slim but not impossible. Just don't let them be captured quickly or easily.

121.content:
"Come on!" said a nerdy-looking man at the counter of the mart. "this is a brand-new berry I just discovered! It's gotta be worth more than that"
The nerdy-looking man was holding a strange-looking berry that was orange-red and covered in green patches--rather unusual looking. It was also quite large for a berry. While most berries were small and easy to carry for a Pokemon, the new strange berry was the size of a bowling ball. It looked as if no pokemon can hold it easily unless they were in their evolved form. Also the strange berry had an odd smell.
The clerk of the mart, a woman in her thirties shook her head. "All berries are sold at a reasonable price no matter if the berry is newly discovered"
"But...this berry is worth more than thirty dollars!" said the nerdy man. "just look at it! It's most unusual in both size and coloring! I'll give you 70 dollars for it!"
"30 is the standard price" said the clerk.
"But this isn't a standard berry" said the man.
"30 is my only offer" said the clerk. "take it or leave it"
The man sighed. "Oh all right. 30 it is, then"

The nerdy man walked out of the mart some minutes later. The man whistled while he walked some distance away from the mart which was located near the very heart of Slateport City. He ducked into an alley and made his way towards the docks through a route that only he knew. Finally he came upon a large warehouse and entered it.
The warehouse seemed darker than it had been when he had left it nearly a hour ago.

"I've managed to sell it" said the man.

From the shadows, a loud belch was heard. "Excellent. Soon I won't be the only one with this condition" said a big booming male voice.

"If you wanted someone else with your condition" said the nerdy man. "why couldn't I eat it then?"

"I want a female companion" said the big voice. "I trust you know the reason"

"..and what if she doesn't want to be with you?" asked the nerdy man. "and anyway, the chances of a woman buying that berry...."

"I know" said the big male voice. "there's a chance that another male will get it and eat it. It's a risk I'm willing to take"

The nerdy man nodded slightly and wrinkled his nose as he caught the smell in the warehouse. "Did you just....?"

"Right before you came back" said the big voice. "would you mind dumping it in the sewer?"

"You know it's a good thing we're such good friends" said the nerdy man.



***************A Few Days Later....***************


"That's a weird-looking berry you got there, Brock" said Ash.
Ash, Brock, May and Max were in the city of Slateport for the opening of the new chocolate factory there. May had wanted to see the brand-new factory and get some chocolate candies there. While they were waiting for the factory to open, Brock had gone shopping for pokemon food. When he had came back to the pokemon center, Ash noticed that Brock was carrying an unusual-looking berry.
"It sure is" said Brock. "it's a newly discovered berry from what the clerk told me"
"A newly discovered berry?" asked Max.
"What's the big deal about that?" scoffed May.
"It's not everyday that a new berry is discovered" said Max.
"Forget about the berry" said May. "I'm in the mood for people food. When does that factory open?"
"Two hours" said Max.
"Two hours?!" whined May. "but I'm starving now! Alright, let's go eat at a restaurant"
"We don't have enough money" said Brock. "I just spent the last of the money on pokemon food"
"Pika!" chimed in Pikachu who was on the shoulder of Ash.
May eyed the berry in Brock's hand. "I'm so hungry I could eat that"
"Berries are meant for pokemon" said Max.
"I don't care" said May, snatching the berry away from Brock. Before anyone could stop her, May took a large bite out of the berry.
"Hmm...delicious" said May.

122.content:
The Jirachi made its way through the thick forest. Even though it was pitch black since the sun had set some forty minutes ago, the little pokemon had no trouble navigating the forest. None of the other pokemon that lived in the forest took much notice of the passing Jirachi. Seeing a Jirachi wasn't all that special. There were probably hundreds of the wish-granting pokemon wandering throughout the world.
Not all Jirachi took the 1,000-year sleep and certainly not this Jirachi. Sleeping was boring. Granting wishes was so much more fun. Carelessly granting wishes was even better. It made stuff more interesting. If someone happened to wish for the end of the world, this little Jirachi will grant it and gleefully watch as the world ended--only to take back the wish as though as if the wish was never spoken out loud to begin with. Of course nobody wished for the world to end---but people did wish for interesting stuff to happen. If the situation got too out of hand, Jirachi would reverse time so that the wish was never granted.
Jirachi had reversed time only a hour ago after granting a human near-unlimited power and the results were truly fascinating. Now, Jirachi was looking for a new human to have fun with. Jirachi had wandered into this dense forest just to see if any humans were in the forest. It wasn't unusual that pokemon trainers would spend the night in a forest like this one.
Jirachi then stumbled upon a small campfire with four humans near it. Two of the humans looked to be asleep while the two other humans looked to be having a pokemon battle. Jirachi was amazed that anyone could sleep with a pokemon battle going on. Jirachi then scanned the minds of all the humans.
It seemed that the four did encounter a Jirachi some years ago. A Jirachi that took the "1,000-year nap" as this Jirachi put it. Nothing all that exciting happened with that Jirachi....interesting, yes...but not all that exciting.
As Jirachi watched, the battle came to an end with the boy in a red hat win. Jirachi was resting high on a tree branch overlooking the camp site. Jirachi decided to rest for a bit and, perhaps later, grant some wishes.

"That was a good match, May" said Ash.
"You're as good as ever" said May.
"I don't let myself get rusty" said Ash.
"Pika" chimed in Pikachu on Ash's shoulder. Ash glanced over at the sleeping Brock and Max.
"It is getting late" said Ash. "...and it's been a long day"
"Let's get some sleep" said May.
